intro: Urceolina galanthoides, commonly known as the Alpine snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the European Alps. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and grows in rocky or alpine meadow habitats. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes other bellflowers. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
